description: Stentor +‎ -ian, from Ancient Greek Στέντωρ (Sténtōr). Stentor was the herald of the Greek forces in the Iliad, noted for his loud voice.

adjectives.description: stentorian (comparative more stentorian, superlative most stentorian)

entries.meaning: (of a voice) Loud, powerful, booming, suitable for giving speeches to large crowds.
(by extension) Stern, authoritarian; demanding of respect.
